### Welcome to Blade's Storybook

# Frontend Development for LedFx

This is a growing place for supporting the frontend development of LedFx.

#### Links:

[![preview](https://img.shields.io/badge/Demo-Live-blue.svg?logo=react&logoColor=white)](https://ledfx.stream) [![preview](https://img.shields.io/badge/Binaries-Download-blue.svg?logoColor=white&logo=data:image/svg+xml;base64,)](https://get.ledfx.stream) [![docs](https://img.shields.io/badge/Docs-Frontend-blue.svg?logo=storybook&logoColor=white)](https://docs.ledfx.stream/) [![docs](https://img.shields.io/badge/Docs-Backend-blue.svg?logo=readthedocs&logoColor=white)](https://docs.ledfx.app/)

## Requirements

* Running LedFx Core
* Node >= 20

## Getting started

`yarn` is recommended, but you can use `npm` aswell

```bash
git clone https://github.com/YeonV/LedFx-Frontend-v2
cd LedFx-Frontend-v2
yarn # npm install
yarn start # npm run start
```

When working with VsCode, you can make use of tasks:

```bash
git clone https://github.com/YeonV/LedFx-Frontend-v2
cd LedFx-Frontend-v2
code .
```

`CTRL`+`SHIFT`+`P` -> Run Task<br />
-> Init Workspace (this does the yarn install)<br />
-> Start Frontend (yarn start)

[App Structure](/story/bladebook-app-structure--page)
